Posts.Title: Safe to assume? Minderella Minderella

Posts.Content: Minderella wrote: I had my mammogram and u/s last Thursday. I know Friday was a holiday, but I had talked to the Breast Health Nurse today and she hadnt heard anything. Is it possibly safe to assume they came back ok? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Safe to assume? Minderella Minderella

Posts.Content: Minderella wrote: 5 Years ago I had what I thought was a mole on my chest, that wound up being Squamous Cell Carcinoma, that was scraped and burned off. I'm supposed to go in for full body checks annually, but I havent. :/ I found out from my mother that several people on her side of the family, namely her dad and aunt had stomach cancer. Would either or both of these put me at a higher risk for bc? Ive tried researching it online but cant seem to find any definate answers and being new to the board, im having a hard time navigating to find info. Im still waiting on the results of my mammo and u/s and even though im willing them to be ok, I still have a nagging feeling that something isnt right. Im reading too much and worrying too much but its hard not to. :(  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Other forms of Cancer..higher risk for bc? Minderella leaf

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2013 11:32PM Minderella wrote: I'd call. Better safe than sorry. Worst they'll do is tell you its fine and wait till your appointment. I'd think they would have you come in though. Good Luck!
